III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Section administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other
Description staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth climbed onto a roof of the building and jumped off in an
attempt to commit suicide. The youth was transferred to U of M in
Ann Arbor to be evaluated by a pediatric neurologist.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
07/05/2024.
Complainant was contact on 07/08/2024, via telephone.
Complainant reported Youth A remains hospitalized for the injuries
sustained from the fall.
Administrator was interviewed on 07/09/2024, at the facility.
Administrator reported Youth A was placed at the facility on
05/23/2024 and has been very vocal about not wanting to be at
the facility. On the day of placement, Youth A came by ambulance
under a chemical restraint, because he didn’t want to be placed in
Saginaw. It took staff several hours to get him to calm down. On
07/03/2024 Youth A met with his adoption worker and was hoping
to be moved but was informed he had to remain at this current
placement and complete the program. After meeting with
Adoption Worker, Youth A walked back to the unit with Therapist.
That is when Youth A ran out of the unit and climbed on the roof.
She and around 20 staff members responded to the crisis call and
went outside trying to help Youth A to come down. Staff managed
to keep the other youths inside, so they didn’t witness the incident.
A portion of the fence had connected to the building, which
allowed Youth A to climb onto the building. Administrator did have
maintenance remove the fence that connects to the building.
Therapist was interviewed on 07/09/2024, at the facility. Therapist
reported she had been working with Youth A for two weeks prior
to this incident Youth A is originally from Detroit and was not
happy about being placed so far away from Detroit. Youth A had
expressed feeling depressed about his placement. On 07/01/2024
2

she met with Youth A, and he expressed feeling sad, but denied
feeling suicidal or having a plan. On 07/02/2024 Youth A was
seen by the psychiatrist and was evaluated, but again denied
feeling suicidal or having a plan. She checked in with Youth A on
7/03/2024 before his visit with Adoption Worker and he reported
feeling fine. She sat in on the visit Youth A had with Adoption
Worker. Therapist expressed to Adoption Worker that Youth A has
been talking about wanting to go back to Detroit. Adoption Worker
encouraged Youth A to continue participating in the program.
Youth A said he wished he could go peacefully in his sleep. She
asked Youth A if he was feeling suicidal and he denied feeling
suicidal. After the visit she walked with Youth A to the unit and
Youth A seemed to be fine. She met Staff 2 in the dining area and
ensured that Staff 2 would remain with Youth A. She was walking
back to her office when she heard Youth A had walked out of the
building. She turned around, went outside and found Youth A was
trying to climb a tree and Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to talk to Youth A
to come down from the tree. Youth A cooperated and came down
from the tree. Youth A was cooperating and walking back to the
unit with her, Staff 1 and Staff 2, and that’s when Youth A ran and
climbed the fence up to the roof. They tried to get Youth A to
come back down, but he refused. She immediately went inside to
call for help and call 911. She said there were multiple staff
including the nurse outside trying to talk to Youth A to come down,
at one point he seemed to have calmed down and sat down on
the roof, but then Youth A stood up and jumped. She said EMS
arrived a few minutes later and transported Youth A to the
hospital. Therapist believes Youth A was triggered because he
was told by Adoption Worker that he had to complete the program
before he can be moved.
Nurse was interviewed on 07/09/2024 at the facility. Nurse
reported she responded to the crisis call on 07/03/2024 when
Youth A climbed to the roof. She went outside with Administrator,
and witnessed Staff 1 and Staff 2 trying to talk to Youth A. She
said Youth A was on the roof for approximately 5 minutes before
he jumped. She said Youth A was alert after he fell. She attended
to Youth A until EMS arrived on campus and immediately
transported Youth A to the hospital. She had Youth A lay still on
his back until EMS arrived.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/15/24 at the hospital by DCWL
Consultant 2. Youth A reported he was at Queen of Angels prior to
coming to the hospital. Youth A said he was feeling stressed out
and frustrated at the previous placement because every day at the
facility was planned and had the same routine. He reported he
3

had attempted to AWOL from there. He reported he told Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Therapist that he was feeling hopeless and that he
just wanted to die in his sleep. He reported staff do a good job at
supervising the youth but noted that no one actually tried to stop
him from getting to the roof. He reported when he was climbing up
the fence, Staff 1 put her hands around his ankles loosely and he
was able to get away. He reported during the incident on the roof,
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Therapist followed him out there. He did this
because he does not want to be at a Child Caring Institution (CCI),
especially in Saginaw as this is the furthest away he has ever
lived. He reported he was being bullied by Youth B and stated
Youth B would kick and punch him when staff were not looking.
Youth A reported he did not get individual therapy at the facility
but did participate in two group therapy sessions. He reported he
does not think therapy would have helped him anyways because
he wanted to be out of the CCI. He reported he would rather be
living on the streets like he was when he was AWOL in Detroit
then go back because he does not feel safe in Saginaw.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 07/11/2024 via
telephone. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A has been
discharged from the hospital and has been transferred to Pine
Rest. Foster Care Worker did not have any concerns for staff
supervision regarding the incident.
Adoption Worker was interviewed on 07/12/2024 via telephone.
Adoption Worker confirmed she was at the facility on 07/03/2024
meeting with Youth A. She said Youth A was upset about his
placement, but he did not express having suicidal thoughts. She
was getting ready to leave the campus, when she witnessed
several staff members outside and Youth A was on the roof. She
got out of the car and attempted to talk to Youth A to come down.
Youth A jumped off the roof and landed on his feet. Youth A was
conscious, and the nurse attended to Youth A until EMS arrived.
She said Youth A was only on the roof for a few minutes. Adoption
Worker did not express any concerns regarding staff supervision
or the facility.
Youth B was interviewed on 08/22/2024 at the facility. Youth B
was on the same unit as Youth A, and he and Youth A used to talk
and play together. Youth B denied bullying or fighting with Youth
A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 08/23/2024 via telephone. Staff 1
reported on 07/03/2024 she was in the dining area with Staff 2
and Youth A. Youth A ran out of the dining area and she and Staff
4

2 immediately followed Youth A outside. Youth A climbed up a
tree and she and Staff 2 were able to get Youth A to come down
from the tree. Therapist also came outside to talk to Youth A. She
said they were all walking back to the unit, and Youth A appeared
calm and was following directions. Youth A then took off running
towards the building. They all followed him, but Youth A quickly
climbed the fence that is attached to the side of the building and
climbed onto the roof. Staff 1 tried to grab Youth A’s feet, but he
was too fast. Therapist ran inside to call for help and she and Staff
1 tried to get Youth A to come down. She said they had about 20
staff members including the nurse outside within a couple of
minutes all trying to get Youth A to come down and 911 was
contacted. Staff 1 reported she is not aware of any incidents
involving Youth B bulling Youth A. She said Youth A was always
upset about being placed at the facility and often spoke about
wanting to go back to Detroit, but he never reported wanting to
hurt himself.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 09/10/2024 via telephone. Staff 2
reported he was assigned to watch Youth A after his visit with his
worker. He said they were in the dining area and Youth A ran out
of the door. He and Staff 1 followed Youth A outside. Youth A
climbed a tree, but he and Staff 1 were able to get Youth A to
come down willing and Youth A then appeared to be calm and he
was not resisting any staff members. All were walking back to the
unit and that’s when Youth A suddenly ran to the nearby fence
and quickly climbed up the fence, onto the roof. They all followed
Youth A and tried to get him to come back down. Therapist went
inside to call for help and he and Staff 1 tried to get Youth A to
come down. Youth A was not listening to them, and within minutes
they had a many staff outside trying to get Youth A to come down.
Youth A was on the roof for less than five minutes before jumping.
He said the nurse immediately attended to Youth A until EMS
arrived. Staff 2 reported Youth A had expressed feeling sad and
not wanting to be at the facility, but he never reported wanting to
hurt himself.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 07/03/2024 written by Therapist is
consist with Therapist’s interview.
• Youth A had a psychiatric evaluation on 06/06/2024 and on
07/02/2024 completed by Psychiatrist Youth A denied
having thoughts to harm himself or others.
• Youth A’s treatment plan/safety plan dated 06/06/2024.
Youth A will be placed with one staff member or team lead
to assist with decreasing his behavior of AWOL wandering,
5

and self-harm. Youth A is provided a safe place on Jacob
Hall unit when he becomes escalated or has distorted
thinking. Youth A will continue to have access to individual
therapy. Therapy session reports for Youth A were
provided and showed session dates of 5/23/202,
05/30/2024, 06/18/2024, 06/25/2024, 07/01/2024, to
process distorted thinking prior to escalation.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 and Staff 2- no disciplinary
actions.
Analysis Based on interviews with Staff and Youth the facility is complaint
with the rule. Staff were supervising the youth and attempted to
stop youth from climbing on to the roof of the building.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
